speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: SCENE VII. Another part of the field.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Enter FLUELLEN and GOWER

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: Kill the poys and the luggage! 'tis expressly

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: against the law of arms: 'tis as arrant a piece of

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: knavery, mark you now, as can be offer't; in your

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: conscience, now, is it not?

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: 'Tis certain there's not a boy left alive; and the

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: cowardly rascals that ran from the battle ha' done

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: this slaughter: besides, they have burned and

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: carried away all that was in the king's tent;

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: wherefore the king, most worthily, hath caused every

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: soldier to cut his prisoner's throat. O, 'tis a

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: gallant king!

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: Ay, he was porn at Monmouth, Captain Gower. What

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: call you the town's name where Alexander the Pig was born!

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Alexander the Great.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: Why, I pray you, is not pig great? the pig, or the

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: great, or the mighty, or the huge, or the

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: magnanimous, are all one reckonings, save the phrase

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: is a little variations.

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: I think Alexander the Great was born in Macedon; his

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: father was called Philip of Macedon, as I take it.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: I think it is in Macedon where Alexander is porn. I

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: tell you, captain, if you look in the maps of the

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: 'orld, I warrant you sall find, in the comparisons

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: between Macedon and Monmouth, that the situations,

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: look you, is both alike. There is a river in

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: Macedon; and there is also moreover a river at

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: Monmouth: it is called Wye at Monmouth; but it is

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: out of my prains what is the name of the other

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: river; but 'tis all one, 'tis alike as my fingers is

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: to my fingers, and there is salmons in both. If you

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: mark Alexander's life well, Harry of Monmouth's life

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: is come after it indifferent well; for there is

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: figures in all things. Alexander, God knows, and

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: you know, in his rages, and his furies, and his

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: wraths, and his cholers, and his moods, and his

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: displeasures, and his indignations, and also being a

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: little intoxicates in his prains, did, in his ales and

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: his angers, look you, kill his best friend, Cleitus.

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Our king is not like him in that: he never killed

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: any of his friends.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: It is not well done, mark you now take the tales out

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: of my mouth, ere it is made and finished. I speak

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: but in the figures and comparisons of it: as

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: Alexander killed his friend Cleitus, being in his

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: ales and his cups; so also Harry Monmouth, being in

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: his right wits and his good judgments, turned away

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: the fat knight with the great belly-doublet: he

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: was full of jests, and gipes, and knaveries, and

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: mocks; I have forgot his name.

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Sir John Falstaff.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: That is he: I'll tell you there is good men porn at Monmouth.

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Here comes his majesty.

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Alarum. Enter KING HENRY, and forces; WARWICK, GLOUCESTER, EXETER, and others

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: I was not angry since I came to France

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Until this instant. Take a trumpet, herald;

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Ride thou unto the horsemen on yon hill:

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: If they will fight with us, bid them come down,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Or void the field; they do offend our sight:

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: If they'll do neither, we will come to them,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: And make them skirr away, as swift as stones

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Enforced from the old Assyrian slings:

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Besides, we'll cut the throats of those we have,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: And not a man of them that we shall take

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Shall taste our mercy. Go and tell them so.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Enter MONTJOY

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: Here comes the herald of the French, my liege.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: His eyes are humbler than they used to be.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: How now! what means this, herald? know'st thou not

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: That I have  fined these bones of mine for ransom?

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Comest thou again for ransom?

speaker: MONTJOY
text_entry: No, great king:

speaker: MONTJOY
text_entry: I come to thee for charitable licence,

speaker: MONTJOY
text_entry: That we may wander o'er this bloody field

speaker: MONTJOY
text_entry: To look our dead, and then to bury them;

speaker: MONTJOY
text_entry: To sort our nobles from our common men.

speaker: MONTJOY
text_entry: For many of our princes--woe the while!--

speaker: MONTJOY
text_entry: Lie drown'd and soak'd in mercenary blood;

speaker: MONTJOY
text_entry: So do our vulgar drench their peasant limbs

speaker: MONTJOY
text_entry: In blood of princes; and their wounded steeds

speaker: MONTJOY
text_entry: Fret fetlock deep in gore and with wild rage

speaker: MONTJOY
text_entry: Yerk out their armed heels at their dead masters,

speaker: MONTJOY
text_entry: Killing them twice. O, give us leave, great king,

speaker: MONTJOY
text_entry: To view the field in safety and dispose

speaker: MONTJOY
text_entry: Of their dead bodies!

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: I tell thee truly, herald,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: I know not if the day be ours or no;

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: For yet a many of your horsemen peer

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: And gallop o'er the field.

speaker: MONTJOY
text_entry: The day is yours.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Praised be God, and not our strength, for it!

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: What is this castle call'd that stands hard by?

speaker: MONTJOY
text_entry: They call it Agincourt.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Then call we this the field of Agincourt,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Fought on the day of Crispin Crispianus.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: Your grandfather of famous memory, an't please your

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: majesty, and your great-uncle Edward the Plack

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: Prince of Wales, as I have read in the chronicles,

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: fought a most prave pattle here in France.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: They did, Fluellen.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: Your majesty says very true: if your majesties is

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: remembered of it, the Welshmen did good service in a

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: garden where leeks did grow, wearing leeks in their

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: Monmouth caps; which, your majesty know, to this

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: hour is an honourable badge of the service; and I do

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: believe your majesty takes no scorn to wear the leek

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: upon Saint Tavy's day.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: I wear it for a memorable honour;

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: For I am Welsh, you know, good countryman.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: All the water in Wye cannot wash your majesty's

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: Welsh plood out of your pody, I can tell you that:

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: God pless it and preserve it, as long as it pleases

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: his grace, and his majesty too!

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Thanks, good my countryman.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: By Jeshu, I am your majesty's countryman, I care not

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: who know it; I will confess it to all the 'orld: I

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: need not to be ashamed of your majesty, praised be

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: God, so long as your majesty is an honest man.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: God keep me so! Our heralds go with him:

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Bring me just notice of the numbers dead

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: On both our parts. Call yonder fellow hither.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Points to WILLIAMS. Exeunt Heralds with Montjoy

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: Soldier, you must come to the king.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Soldier, why wearest thou that glove in thy cap?

speaker: WILLIAMS
text_entry: An't please your majesty, 'tis the gage of one that

speaker: WILLIAMS
text_entry: I should fight withal, if he be alive.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: An Englishman?

speaker: WILLIAMS
text_entry: An't please your majesty, a rascal that swaggered

speaker: WILLIAMS
text_entry: with me last night; who, if alive and ever dare to

speaker: WILLIAMS
text_entry: challenge this glove, I have sworn to take him a box

speaker: WILLIAMS
text_entry: o' th' ear: or if I can see my glove in his cap,

speaker: WILLIAMS
text_entry: which he swore, as he was a soldier, he would wear

speaker: WILLIAMS
text_entry: if alive, I will strike it out soundly.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: What think you, Captain Fluellen? is it fit this

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: soldier keep his oath?

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: He is a craven and a villain else, an't please your

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: majesty, in my conscience.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: It may be his enemy is a gentleman of great sort,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: quite from the answer of his degree.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: Though he be as good a gentleman as the devil is, as

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: Lucifer and Belzebub himself, it is necessary, look

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: your grace, that he keep his vow and his oath: if

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: he be perjured, see you now, his reputation is as

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: arrant a villain and a Jacksauce, as ever his black

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: shoe trod upon God's ground and his earth, in my

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: conscience, la!

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Then keep thy vow, sirrah, when thou meetest the fellow.

speaker: WILLIAMS
text_entry: So I will, my liege, as I live.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Who servest thou under?

speaker: WILLIAMS
text_entry: Under Captain Gower, my liege.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: Gower is a good captain, and is good knowledge and

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: literatured in the wars.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Call him hither to me, soldier.

speaker: WILLIAMS
text_entry: I will, my liege.

speaker: WILLIAMS
text_entry: Exit

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Here, Fluellen; wear thou this favour for me and

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: stick it in thy cap: when Alencon and myself were

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: down together, I plucked this glove from his helm:

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: if any man challenge this, he is a friend to

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Alencon, and an enemy to our person; if thou

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: encounter any such, apprehend him, an thou dost me love.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: Your grace doo's me as great honours as can be

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: desired in the hearts of his subjects: I would fain

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: see the man, that has but two legs, that shall find

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: himself aggrieved at this glove; that is all; but I

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: would fain see it once, an please God of his grace

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: that I might see.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Knowest thou Gower?

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: He is my dear friend, an please you.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Pray thee, go seek him, and bring him to my tent.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: I will fetch him.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: Exit

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: My Lord of Warwick, and my brother Gloucester,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Follow Fluellen closely at the heels:

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: The glove which I have given him for a favour

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: May haply purchase him a box o' th' ear;

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: It is the soldier's; I by bargain should

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Wear it myself. Follow, good cousin Warwick:

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: If that the soldier strike him, as I judge

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: By his blunt bearing he will keep his word,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Some sudden mischief may arise of it;

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: For I do know Fluellen valiant

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: And, touched with choler, hot as gunpowder,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: And quickly will return an injury:

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Follow and see there be no harm between them.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Go you with me, uncle of Exeter.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Exeunt
